content: I often have the problem that when I call "try" and I delete the "try" line in specific ways (i.e. undo or selecting a big code block and pasting...), the try process doesnt stop and Isabelle doesn't work properly until the try process stops naturally. Is there a way to force it to stop without restarting the program entirely?
If you are under windows that could be the sledgehammer issue that has been reported
(issue that no windows person seems to want to debug actually)
I have task manager open and squash running eprover.exe processes when things become slow
